$HIMS now down ~75% from its highs

Morgan Stanley initiates $CIFR at Overweight with a $38 price target.

Frames Cipher‚Äôs data centers as ‚ÄúREIT endgame‚Äù assets that should be valued like contracted infrastructure rather than $BTC equities.

UBS sees $AMZN AWS growing ~38% in 2026  

If AWS accelerates from 24% to 38% while spending $200B would show the capex is converting into revenue and finally kills the "overbuilding" narrative completely.

$GOOGL is issuing about $15B of debt with maturities stretching all the way to 2066.

They are funding the AI buildout with cheap capital at a time when AI infrastructure spend is ramping.

$BMNR now holds about 3.6% of all Ethereum.

They added ~40K $ETH last week binging their total to ~4.33M.

$HIMS extends losses to ~22% after $NVO said it is suing over knockoff obesity drugs.

This comes as the FDA signals full enforcement on compounded GLP 1s and the company exits compounded semaglutide.

$MU is trading lower on reports Samsung is already approved by $NVDA to supply HBM4 for Rubin and may start production this month.

Micron does not ramp HBM4 until mid 2026 which brings fresh worries about losing early share in the highest margin part of memory.

$TMDX gets full FDA IDE approval to launch the next-gen OCS Heart ENHANCE trial.

Another step toward expanding its moat in organ transport and perfusion.
$HIMS down over 16% in overnight trading

A leaked ad suggests this is what OpenAI‚Äôs first Jony Ive designed device may look like.

It is their first real step from pure software into owning the hardware layer.
H/t @litcapital
Here‚Äôs the Starlink Super Bowl ad showing how low-Earth orbit connectivity is being positioned as mainstream broadband

Wild to see the U.S. software developer job market over the past 5 years.

Hiring in 2021 & 2022 was pulled forward by zero rate capital & a land grab mentality across tech.

A lot of people will look at this & think ‚ÄúAI is taking jobs‚Äù but this looks like normalization to me.
$GOOGL has overtaken $NVDA as the favorite to end the year as the world‚Äôs most valuable company.

üì∫ HOW TO FRAME TRADES IN MEGA-CAP TECH RIGHT NOW

Recent strength in mega-cap tech was used as a source of funds rather than sustained upside. So, what's next?

‚Äì $GOOGL had strong earnings but was sold into. The key level to watch now is ~$319‚Äîholding it keeps the trade viable, losing it opens downside and likely signals weak follow-through across all mega caps.

‚Äì $AMZN is a potential gap-fill trade toward ~$214, but failure to fill that gap would invalidate valuation arguments (Amazon is at its lowest valuation ever) and suggest staying away.

‚Äì $MSFT is a broken bounce with resistance near $408‚Äì$420 after a rejected gap down.

‚Äì $NVDA remains range-bound; ~$182 is the critical support‚Äîholding it could stabilize price, losing it would be disappointing and difficult to trade.

‚Äì $TSLA offered a trade off the 200-day moving average into the 8-day, and now must prove it can hold higher and reclaim resistance.

‚Äì $AAPL has been the best recent performer for me. It is now above key moving averages and may work toward $300, though it looks somewhat extended. I am keeping an eye on $AAPL.

So, frame trades tightly around clear levels. If leaders can‚Äôt turn green and hold support, upside in mega-cap tech is still limited.

Market thoughts heading into the day from the 20@5:20 üí≠

You can‚Äôt control the market, but you can control your state. Get your mind right, stay disciplined, and let the process guide the day.

üì∫ THIS RALLY ONLY WORKS IF ONE THING HAPPENS

Today's newsletter: t3live.com/rd

Friday‚Äôs sharp rally in $SPY / $QQQ put the market at a decision point. The key now is follow-through. 

If recent pullbacks hold and selling pressure can‚Äôt push indexes lower, the move could turn into a continuation higher. 

Sector rotation is clearly underway, with strength in mid-caps $MDY and stabilization in small caps $IWM, suggesting broader participation. 

Broad index trades may offer cleaner setups than chasing individual stocks right now.
Mostly green arrows around the World but a lot of cross currents under the surface. $SPX 6870‚Äì6902 needs to hold to show real commitment to Friday‚Äôs bounce, otherwise things can get sloppy again.
